page.title: 09King Alfred
page.content: From 846 to 899 King Alfred was on the throne. Alfred was the King who saved England from being conquered by the Vikings. Alfred was defeated many times. Finally he managed to defeat the Vikings. Alfred was supposed to have burnt some cakes in an old womans house while hiding from the Vikings. There is a monument near Athelney farm to King Alfred. Alfred was forced to pay the Vikings a large sum of money and in return they agreed to go away. In the year 878 his army defeated the Vikings at Edington and King Guthrum agreed to leave Wessex and also to be baptized into the Christian faith. In Burrow Bridge there is a pub called the King Alfred and inside there is a table called King Alfreds table. It is very old and looks wooden.
